intro: Alysicarpus bhuibavadensis, commonly known as the Bhubhava grass, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant is typically found in grasslands and disturbed soils, thriving in tropical and subtropical climates. Its seeds are enclosed in pods, a feature common among members of the legume family, and it plays a role in soil nitrogen fixation.
